name: Transcription Document Header
description: The Transcription Document Header segment (TXA) contains information about transcribed documents. This segment is used to convey metadata about clinical documents such as discharge summaries, operative reports, radiology reports, pathology reports, and other transcribed clinical documentation. It provides document identification, status, authorship, and administrative details essential for document management workflows.

cardinality.note: TXA is required when transmitting transcription documents

TXA.1.name: Set ID - TXA
TXA.1.description: This field contains the sequence number for the TXA segment when multiple documents are present in a single message.
TXA.1.generationHint: Sequential numbering: 1, 2, 3, etc. for multiple documents

TXA.2.name: Document Type
TXA.2.description: This field identifies the type of document being transmitted. Values from HL7 Table 0270 - document type.
TXA.2.generationHint: Common types: DS (discharge), OP (operative), RP (radiology), HP (H&P)

TXA.3.name: Document Content Presentation
TXA.3.description: This field describes how the document content is presented. Values from HL7 Table 0191 - type of referenced data.

validValues.description: Other application data, typically uninterpreted binary data

TXA.3.generationHint: Most common: FT (formatted text), TX (plain text), SD (scanned document)

TXA.4.name: Activity Date/Time
TXA.4.description: This field contains the date and time when the clinical activity (procedure, examination, etc.) that the document describes took place.
TXA.4.generationHint: Date/time of the clinical event being documented

TXA.5.name: Primary Activity Provider Code/Name
TXA.5.description: This field identifies the healthcare provider who performed the primary clinical activity being documented.
TXA.5.generationHint: Attending physician, surgeon, or primary provider for the documented activity

TXA.6.name: Origination Date/Time
TXA.6.description: This field contains the date and time when the document was originally created or dictated.
TXA.6.generationHint: When document was first created/dictated - may differ from transcription time

TXA.7.name: Transcription Date/Time
TXA.7.description: This field contains the date and time when the document was transcribed.

TXA.8.name: Edit Date/Time
TXA.8.description: This field contains the date and time when the document was last edited or revised.
TXA.8.generationHint: Most recent edit timestamp for version control

TXA.9.name: Originator Code/Name
TXA.9.description: This field identifies the person who originally authored or dictated the document content.
TXA.9.generationHint: Document author - physician dictating the report

TXA.10.name: Assigned Document Authenticator
TXA.10.description: This field identifies the healthcare provider assigned to authenticate (sign) the document.
TXA.10.generationHint: Provider responsible for signing/authenticating the document

TXA.11.name: Transcriptionist Code/Name
TXA.11.description: This field identifies the person who transcribed the document.

TXA.12.name: Unique Document Number
TXA.12.description: This field contains a unique identifier for the document across all systems and versions.

TXA.13.name: Parent Document Number
TXA.13.description: This field contains the unique document number of a parent document when this document is an addendum or correction.
TXA.13.generationHint: Reference to original document for addenda and corrections

TXA.14.name: Placer Order Number
TXA.14.description: This field contains the placer order number when the document is associated with a specific order.
TXA.14.generationHint: Link to ordering system identifier for document

TXA.15.name: Filler Order Number
TXA.15.description: This field contains the filler order number when the document is associated with a specific order.
TXA.15.generationHint: Link to fulfilling system identifier for document

TXA.16.name: Unique Document File Name
TXA.16.description: This field contains the file name or path where the document is stored in the system.
TXA.16.generationHint: System file name or storage location reference

TXA.17.name: Document Completion Status
TXA.17.description: This field indicates the current completion status of the document. Values from HL7 Table 0271 - document completion status.
TXA.17.generationHint: Status progression: DI → DO → PA → AU → LA

TXA.18.name: Document Confidentiality Status
TXA.18.description: This field indicates the confidentiality level of the document. Values from HL7 Table 0272 - document confidentiality status.
TXA.18.generationHint: Most common: U (usual control), R (restricted for sensitive cases)

TXA.19.name: Document Availability Status
TXA.19.description: This field indicates whether the document is currently available for viewing. Values from HL7 Table 0273 - document availability status.
TXA.19.generationHint: Most documents are AV (available) unless deleted or obsoleted

TXA.20.name: Document Storage Status
TXA.20.description: This field indicates how and where the document is stored. Values from HL7 Table 0275 - document storage status.

TXA.21.name: Document Change Reason
TXA.21.description: This field contains the reason for any change to the document content or status.
TXA.21.generationHint: Free text reason for document revisions or status changes

TXA.22.name: Authentication Person, Time Stamp
TXA.22.description: This field contains information about who authenticated the document and when.

TXA.23.name: Distributed Copies (Code and Name of Recipient)
TXA.23.description: This field identifies recipients who should receive copies of the document.
TXA.23.generationHint: Distribution list for document copies (consulting physicians, etc.)

notes: TXA segment is essential for clinical document management workflows
Set ID (TXA.1), Document Type (TXA.2), Unique Document Number (TXA.12), and Completion Status (TXA.17) are required
Document lifecycle: creation → transcription → review → authentication → distribution
Multiple timestamps track document workflow from origination through authentication
Confidentiality and availability status control access to sensitive documents
Parent document relationships support addenda and correction workflows
Authentication details provide legal signature requirements for clinical documents

conditional.TXA.4: Should be provided for procedure-related documents
conditional.TXA.6: Origination time helps with document workflow tracking
conditional.TXA.9: Author identification is critical for clinical responsibility
conditional.TXA.10: Authenticator required for legal document validity

relationships.TXA.6_TXA.7: Transcription time should be after or equal to origination time
relationships.TXA.7_TXA.8: Edit time should be after transcription time
relationships.TXA.17_authentication: Authenticated documents should have authenticator information
relationships.TXA.2_TXA.18: Psychiatric documents often have higher confidentiality levels

validation.TXA.2: Must be valid HL7 Table 0270 document type
validation.TXA.17: Must be valid HL7 Table 0271 completion status
validation.TXA.18: Must be valid HL7 Table 0272 confidentiality status when present
validation.TXA.19: Must be valid HL7 Table 0273 availability status when present
validation.TXA.20: Must be valid HL7 Table 0275 storage status when present
